original: LINDAHL, Åke Einar, Direktör, Malmö, f Malmö 31/5 89 av grhdl A L o Alma Dahl. Malmö h a l, Bröd Bendtz hdlssk Malmö, Groenes hdlssk Hamburg. Anst Alfr Lindahls imp.AB Malmö 05—07, fma Fredr Sjöberg & Dahl Hamburg fr 08, inneh av, styr.ordf o vkst dir i denna sed. 19 (Sj & D grund i Hamburg 59, huv.del flytt t Malmö o omb t AB 33). Mångår styr.led Sv kyrkis församl, Sv skol- o föreläsn.frn o Sv fattigv i Hamb. V. ordf Malmö köpm.frn, styr.led Ackord-centr:s centr.styr, suppl hdlskamm:s opin.-nmd, rev S Sv manuf.gross.frb, styr.led Hdls-klasseris i Malmö under st. stift, v. ordf Sv filatelistfrn Malmöavd, styr.led Skånefru 89 års män. Resor i flert europ länd 09—33, bosatt i Hamb 07—33. Frimurare, Odd Fellow, PB; fi ordnar o utm.t f caritativ verksamh. Hobbies: Antik konst, filateli.
translated: LINDAHL, Åke Einar, Director, Malmö, born in Malmö on May 31, 1889, son of merchant A L and Alma Dahl. Attended Bröd Bendtz business school in Malmö and Groenes business school in Hamburg. Employed at Alfr Lindahls import company in Malmö from 1905 to 1907, then at Fredr Sjöberg & Dahl in Hamburg from 1908. Became the owner, chairman of the board, and managing director in this company since 1919 (Sjöberg & Dahl established in Hamburg in 1859, main office later moved to Malmö and renamed the company in 1933). Long-time board member of the Swedish church congregation, Swedish school and lecture association, and Swedish poor relief in Hamburg. Vice chairman of the Malmö merchant association, board member of the Central Board of the bankruptcy settlement agency, member of the Commercial Chamber's public committee, auditor of the Swedish manufacturer's wholesale association, board member of the Commercial-class society in Malmö under the city diocese, vice chairman of the Swedish philatelic association's Malmö branch, and board member of the Skånefru 89 years men's association. Traveled extensively in several European countries from 1909 to 1933, resided in Hamburg from 1907 to 1933. Member of Freemasons, Odd Fellow, and the PB society; received awards and distinctions for charitable activities. Hobbies include antique art and philately.

career.occupational_title: Owner, Chairman of the Board, and Managing Director
